c8F8KOIcT3SqD2i8atxK6g.text: As we currently stand, this place has 4.5 stars on 129 reviews. I'm completely flabbergasted with that statement based off tonight. Not only did it take a god awful amount of time to get our beers, but the $14 wings were uncomfortably undercooked and squishy despite saying "grilled and fried" on the menu and two of my undersized chicken tenders were strangely hard in the middle. On top of it all, these guys had half of their TVs and projectors playing some women's basketball when the sweet sixteen games were not even playing!! This "dive" bar doesn't even deserve that term...

rztxJ_j1bPvHeiWnMWELoA.text: When you enter this place it smells. Staff seems really annoyed that your there and taking away from their hang out time. The food is disgusting. We ordered pretzel bits and they came with a bowl of cheese whiz! Maybe the drunk friends like that. Now the French fries were good but the burger was tasteless. The group I was with absolutely hated the place but I tried to keep an open mind because it's in my neighborhood. Well they made it impossible to like with how uncaring the staff was that we were there. Now the funny thing is that many people have complained about this place on Next Door so I added my review to their issues. No sooner did I do that, I got a message from the owner to go somewhere else! Never told me who he was or even asked why I didn't like it. just go somewhere else. You got it! Place won't last long!

2cXJUKdycMfZ2nwxPvNWcA.text: Have been there twice, the first time the owner was present and service was exceptional. Today, he wasn't present and service was non existent, with the exception of the Busboy whom we had to utilize to gain the attention of the servers and to even get salt and pepper. The bartenders were either talking to each other or on their phones. The Busboy was the Hardest working employee there today. Definitely need more craft beers on tap as well. Very disappointing as the hubby and I really liked it on the first visit. Do like the decor however.

XyFJK2s6pgn8bRs4J_wELg.text: Love this place! Staff is beyond friendly and attentive, food is amazing! The French Dip rocks and the Ceviche is a must have. The owner stopped by our table to check on us and was super friendly. Definitely a great place and an awesome addition to Thunderbird Square!

LA4cdFLsAsHVqZrp2KK9rw.text: This place has abnormally delicious food- we got the sliders and the kale caesar salad with chicken and a couple beers, and there was plenty to look at. The decor is a hybrid that we decided was "Medieval Cowboy Rock" and has a lounge area with unique arcade games with cool red and black decor. If you can make a weekday lunch you will get quick attention and friendly service. Love it, and will definitely be back.

1tjrTRem1u_39q0I2mDlIw.text: Fun atmosphere and good eats.  Our server provided outstanding service and was very friendly.  The lavash with havarti cheese was excellent, chrispy and tasty.  The Boursin Burger was good, but arrived to the table with over-cooked dry meat.  Even when "medium" was ordered.  I am sure if I informed the server it would have been replaced with a new Burger, but I decided to eat it instead and save the time.  The bar appeared to have a real nice cool neighborhood vibe.

etYepQPIzFQkORN3M_Dc6A.text: Where do I start?  I was in Scottsdale on business. It was my last night in town and I wanted something good. I found this place on yelp and it was only .5 miles from my hotel so I walked over. I was immediately greeted by the owner and some of the staff. Took a seat at the bar and that's when the adventure began. The bartender presented me with a great menu and took my drink order. I had a cold beer before I knew it. So let me say this. If you are looking for fine cuisine this is not the place. If you want hearty and delicious pub style food cook to perfection, you found it. I mentioned deviled eggs (not on the menu). The bartender mentioned it to the cook and next thing you know I have 3 kinds sitting in front of me. I also ordered the spicy shrimp with mushrooms. It was a huge plate and also cooked perfectly.  So I'm having a great conversation with a couple guys that were sitting next to me at the bar. Come to find out one of them is Jason the owner of the place. He made me feel as if I was a long time patron and I belonged there just a much as the fixtures. We had a great conversation about bars, rock and roll and the Scottsdale area. Jason had to go, but I continued my evening with a couple more cocktails before my journey back to my room.  Long story short... Great food and drink, great staff, good music and no riff riff in this place. I can't wait to return to Scottsdale just to visit the Rooster!

PSGh8pxzVsU-g3udk4PyAg.text: I was looking for a place on Scottsdale road to meet my lady, so I went to Yelp and I found this place, it said it was Hot and New so we decided to give it a try.  It was a little difficult to find, so my girlfriend called them to find out exactly where they are and she was told;  "THAT YOU CAN'T MISS US, WE HAVE A SHORT RED SCHOOL BUS PARKED IN FRONT WITH A GOLDEN COCK ON TOP". The decor is a mix of medieval knight's armor, a stuffed fox w/sun glasses, a bear rug lying on the ceiling and a few video games. It's a cool decor if I just want to have a few drinks with friends and is slightly reminiscent of a 70's bar, without the smoke.  We sat down in one of the booths and a very nice young lady came over to help us. The young lady did the best she could do considering the situation; this was her first day and she just walked in five minutes earlier. She didn't know what was on the menu. Now if a place is going to be  successful they must setup a system to train their newbie's. Most restaurant/bars will have a seasoned server doing the serving and the newbie would tag along to see how its done. This way the customer gets the best experience possible with little or no hiccups and the newbie gets trained and setup for success. Our server had such a great attitude we decided to deal with it, but every question we asked, she had to ask someone else. To me this is all managements fault and the lack of attention to detail could be fatal to any business. Ask Jon Taffer!  I did take a quick look at the menu before choosing to come here, but I should have looked closer. I was looking to get a Burger and Fries, it's my base barometer when I try a new place since if you can't get this right, the other stuff probably isn't going to be right either.  After getting a menu I spotted my hamburger it was the first item listed on the top. The burger was a 6oz burger, lettuce, tomato, onion and cheese. It was $10 and came with your choice of a salad or potato chips. Wait, What Potato Chips, are you kidding me? NO FRENCH FRIES, NO ONION RINGS what are they thinking? I didn't object to the fact that I didn't get a burger and fries for $ 10, the objection was there was not a single French Fry or Onion Ring to be had not even as a side order.  Now everyone knows that there is nothing more American than Hamburger and French fries, not hamburger and potato chips or Salad. The sides that you could order were Sauteed Broccoli, Spiraled Zucchini, Spaghetti Squash and Spaghetti and red sauce. Of course everyone knows when you're going out to get your buzz on, your main thought is what healthy choices go with this high fat, high sodium, high carbohydrate food and the five domestic beers, two Scotch/sodas and two shots of Jagermeister you're about to drink.  No, I want hamburger and fries and onion rings and anything that is Salty, Crispy, Sweet, Charred, Spicy or Crunchy. This menu is just poorly planned. Additionally, we were told that it was happy hour but the only happy hour food offered were sliders for $3.00 a piece, but of course if I'm getting sliders I'm probably going to get at least three, which would have been nine bucks which happened to be the exact same price as the non happy hour menu price for three sliders, so no bargain here, again a management issue.  Now I will say the Burger was good and my lady said that the salad was better than most side salads she's had, the lettuce was crisp and fresh, the croutons were crunchy, but she really wanted French fries with her burger.  On another note; I'm posting a separate review for the Lays Company to let them know how much I enjoyed the potato chips. NOT! Here's the thing when I go to your establishment, I want you to WOW me with your attention to detail, the service and the quality of food you serve. If you want to serve potato chips, they have to be made in house and be fantabulous, not poured out of a bag, I go to Circle K to get Potato chips out of a bag.  We ended the meal by asking if they have any dessert substance. She asked a colleague and came back with the three choices, which by the way weren't listed on the menu. We opted for the Salted Carmel cake. The cake came with vanilla ice cream and was ok. However we both could tell it was a frozen store bought or food service vendor purchased cake. This was another opportunity to shine that fell short. There are so many locally sourced bakeries in the valley that will work with you to design desserts that are fresh, yummy and unique to you. If you don't aspire to be different with your food and service, then you're serving the same drinks and beers that the public can get anywhere else. At that point there is no reason for us to come to your establishment.  If you want to thrive you must improve.  I will give you a 2nd chance when your website shows the improvements in the menu.  GOOD LUCK

AOCZo0LSGqJSVFwitW_rIg.text: The worst service that I have ever had in my life. We got one beer in an hours time and the server never checked on us at all. We had a party of 6, you would think she would have been motivated. She came up and took an appetizer order but only asked a few of us. Next thing I new she was gone and I never got my order in. After that we sat dry with no more drinks nor did she check on us again. We got frustrated and one of us had to go up to her and tell her we need our checks and we are leaving. She didn't even care at all. She only had 4 tables including us. Management never came over to check on us or ask why we cancelled our food. This place is amateur hour. If they want to survive they need to get better servers and management needs to be on point. So disappointed in our time there. Hopefully they get it fixed. Would have loved to actually try their food.

O7H0FWF2bUQCko-Q5xoriA.text: Love the decor, service was fantastic, food was pretty good!  They accommodated our large group, provided separate checks for 6 families and our waiter did an outstanding job.

2vYCCABX517Rgu1Ektu8fw.text: We came after golf on a Friday and were a little surprised that they did not offer a happy hour. Then again this place is pretty much a bar that has really good food so we kind of understood that would not make sense for them.  The staff was all super nice, attentive and knowledgeable about the food options.  We ordered the meatball platter and for $9.50 it was a pretty good value with three large meatballs, lots of tasty and chunky marinara and melted cheese. Instead of automatically serving you bread or pasta with it they offered a two dollar up charge to add a side dish or bread. We got nothing and were happy as we were saving ourselves for other items on the menu.  Next we ordered the Boursin burger (with caramelized onions and lots of bacon) medium. It came out nearly well done and we did not return it but it had good flavor and the french fries were amazing as others have mentioned.  Our third order was the hot and sweet wings as recommended by Joe our server at the bar. He was right, they took the base buffalo wing to a new level with the hint of honey. They are baked and then grilled so they are not greasy but yet moist. It would be nice if they were a little bit crispier but they did taste very good.  While we were enjoying our wings we saw a staff member sit at the bar with a couple of other patrons. We then noticed a pizza stand and then a medium size what looked like an extremely thin crust pizza come out to them. We asked our server Joe about it and he said that it was actually a large lavash cracker with melted white cheese and pieces of meatballs on it. It had no tomato sauce. Well the staffer sitting with the patrons turned out to be the chef and lo and behold about 10 minutes later they brought us a small version of the same pizza on the house. It was delicious! Being from Chicago we are used to extremely cracker like, thin crust pizza. This totally filled the bill! Joe said you can order it with any toppings. They must not want to sell a lot of these because they call it lavash and don't even mention the word pizza in the menu description. Maybe there are too many people that don't know thin crust pizza out here and would be surprised and disappointed if they called it pizza. We can guarantee you that if they're from Chicago they would know exactly what it is if it was listed as cracker thin crust pizza.  There are plenty of TVs to watch sports and the only thing we didn't care too much for were the extremely small seats on the high stools at the tables across from the bar.  The ambience is definitely a sports bar with extremely elevated food. It still had a slight grungy atmosphere to it (lots of tattoos etc. on the staff) so don't expect anything more upscale than a bar-like feel. If we were in that area again and hungry we would probably return and get that lavash "pizza".

LhOhHbBAP6XK9ld9k-DMVg.text: Awesome food and people. Jason, the owner, is always making sure that everything is perfect. VbbhaxK4jyMtIbSL87Uv_w.text: This place is great! My husband and I stopped by this gem not knowing anything about it. We just wanted some bar food and a drink but we ended up having the best restaurant experience as "first timers" I think we've ever had.   The decor was right up our alley so I was automatically on board but the fact that 2 employees said hi to us as soon as we walked in was awesome. That doesn't seem like much but really makes you feel welcome. We've both been in the industry for 20+yrs so our standards are high & The Rooster's staff was on point! Andy was fantastic, down to earth and perfectly attentive. He treated us as if we had been coming in for years.   The Bloody Mary's were awesome & the food... SO GOOD!  We had the buffalo chips, fried chicken sandwich & the Reuben with the best crispy fries. My only complaint is that it's not in Chandler but we'll make the trip!   Thank you to The Rooster Tavern & it's fabulous staff for a great afternoon

ohLqFvpGf8ZuEnudl7HPYA.text: Whenever I ask my kid where he wants to go to eat he always says the Rooster! I am happy to have found this little gem and the service we have had there is nothing but great.

dAAYAnTj8V7owWcVAinzzg.text: Went here on Friday early evening and sat on the patio. Such awesome vibes from the moment we walked in. You kind of think "oh just another pub", but it's so far from that. Sweet interior, amazing food (finally a place that serves shoe string fries!!!!) and so many staff going around to tables, including ours, making sure everyone was having a good time. The food was so good but the service is what will make us come back. Mary was our server and she was so sweet and efficient even though she had a ton of tables. My hubby spilled his beer by accident and Mary was so quick to clean up his mess and even after he said no worries about getting another one, as it was his fault, she still brought him a new one. Little touches like that are what keep people happy!!!!! The owner of this place could really teach others a thing or two. Glad we found this place.

Sfnu7N6X6vJrvxiTJYZ_8A.text: Great neighborhood bar!  Staff is friendly and good service. We had the sliders and they were fab. Prices are reasonable and they pour a good drink.  They are new and here to stay!!

Photo of The Rooster Tavern - Scottsdale, AZ, United States

ipOzSCXL8GH592Sm6Myi4g.text: Pretty cool vibe in this place, the staff and owner make you feel at home, which is important in a neighborhood bar. The menu is eclectic, from sliders and bruschetta to ceviche and burritos, to sandwiches and small dinner plates. I had the sliders, there are two types: traditional burger type and meatball type. The burger type was very good. However the meatball slider was simply wow. Very good recommendation by our server, Bobbi. My son had one of the meatball sliders as well and definitely concurred. He also ordered the ceviche, which I sampled. Perhaps the best ceviche I've had at a bar. Spicy, but not to hot, not swimming in sauce with plenty of substance.  Like the menu, the decor is also eclectic. But it works for me. The only reason it didn't get a 5 is a pet peeve of mine. We went for a mid-week lunch, and while it wasn't super busy, neither was it empty. They had a single server working the tables, as well as the bar. The owner was working the crowd, which is good, but imho, there were times it would have been nice to have seen him helping his server out. While we were not displeased with our service, she was attentive and we never had to wait more than a minute or so for her attention, she was stretched to her limit. Perhaps this was an aberration, as the owner seemed very attentive to the clientele, when I go back, I'll watch for this.  Regardless, the only other issue is finding it. It's kind of in a funky location in a strip mall in between Thunderbird and Acoma on Scottsdale Road. The strip mall is in two tiers: those establishments fronting Thunderbird, and then another row of retail further back from the road on the other side of the parking lot. This is where Rooster's sits. I'll definitely be going back.

MLmbc7wo5cuLXUI9wCwVQw.text: For being a new hot spot this place seems to be doing things right. Yesterday was my first time there. My friend found them on Yelp & we decided to check it out. They sit on the corner of a strip mall (old Dilly's Deli) The vibe when we immediately walked in was welcoming & warm. We sat at the bar, surprisingly next to someone we knew. Our drink orders were taken immediately. The decor is eclectic & cool. They have a bear rug hanging on the ceiling above the bar. They have a motor cycle in the restaurant along with a ski ball game. We met Jason (the owner) who was very friendly & funny. I like that he mingles with his customers. We ordered their grilled chicken wings. They were delicious. The guy next to me had the meatballs, they also looked delicious. The only thing I would like to see change, is having more micro brews available, not just Kilt Lifter. We will definitely be back.

-0aAphRJyLmW3dPUD3ksZw.text: I never give five stars  I do believe this is a nice place. It's halfway between a dive bar and a restaurant. It's too polished to be dive. Too much money went into interior decorating for it to be a grungy dive bar. And the food is too good  Okay, on the advice of other Yelpers, I knew exactly what to order here, and I went right for it. But before ordering, I gauged the bartender's ability. I asked him what was good here, and what he specialized in. He told me that he knows how to make all kinds of drinks. And he said it with a straight face. So I decided to go for an old-fashioned. I opted for a well whisky, which I wish I'd upgraded to a familiar name. But the Old Fashioned was spot on. Not too sweet, not too bitter. Literally halfway in-between, which is what you want. Good, clean taste. Bartender guy knows what he is doing!  Next I opted for the meatball slider. Giant meatball with sauce, nestled between a very soft pretzel bun. Never had anything like this before, and I was an instant fan  I then opted for the fried fish taco. For three bucks, I got two pretty large peices of fish in one taco with cabbage, and a mystery yellow tartar sauce (something of a honey mustard tartar?). I definitely got my money's worth with this taco. There was enough fried fish in there for two tacos, actually. So for $3, you definitely get a good deal.   I could of stopped eating with those two selections, but the wings and the French dip were well-reviewed, so I dug into my stomach reserves, and made some extra space. And boy did it pay off!   Wings with buffalo sauce were total winners. These are baked then grilled wings. Because frying wings is not the right way to do things. Size of the wings was medium, and the taste of the chicken was very flavorful and moist. The last thing you want is over-cooked wings, which happens all-too-often. And you don't want inedible wings, which are dipped in a sauce that's too over-poweringly spicy. Buffalo was just spicy enough to give a kick, but not too spicy to require a glass of milk.   Monday night here is trivia night, and the deejay for the trivia was a pretty cool guy, and several people were playing. I feel this is the kind of place you can go to, be left alone, have fun, and enjoy good food and drinks for a reasonable price.   If I was local to Scottsdale, this would be one of my weekly go-to hotspots

ffpYGczksTSc4lnb7r9XTA.text: There are a lot of dive bars out there, but dare I say this place is a modern version of a dive bar?  Great drinks, awesome service and a bit of a biker bar feel.  Felt like this place might be one of the True classic bars in Scottsdale and we'll be back.

oaLBYC51W-DKbR1AKTBmHA.text: We've been here several times....always good service and it's a popular and loud place. I've tried a few things, but we always get the fish and chips on Friday and it's really good (according to my husband) ....served with crisp thin fries and coleslaw. I love the meatballs with spaghetti squash for a side, and I bring home an extra side of that yummy squash almost every time. I enjoy a crisp cold glass of rose with that, too! I tried the Mac and cheese but it was runny and not very hot. Won't do that one again, but we will be back to the Rooster! Go find this place, tucked away near Scottsdale Road and Thunderbird, ....you'll be glad you did!

t5dsSfxtAj1S92h7-CcKrQ.text: Yuppie Dive Bar.  Good Bar Food with Cold Beers at a reasonable price!   Darts in the back & a decent patio area.  We'll be back.

f6RyCf0ghNDiMmuoz5zm8Q.text: Where shall I begin ? I've been excited to come try this place and was less than impressed ,The service was slow and our server was less than enthusiastic to be working . The food was less than desirable, when our server came by to ask if everything was ok ? I actually said no , I thought that maybe he could tell because my burger had to be taken apart and have this gross white stuff taken off etc. I asked what is this stuff? The food is awful ,He had replied it was the cheese for the burger I said oh ok didn't offer to get me something or have any explanation or any thing else and just walked  away. Ok what is the point of asking how our food is if your not gonna do anything to make it right ? I had to dissect my burger just to be able to choke it down. My cousin had ordered a chicken sandwich although it looked delicious he said it was just meh ? The atmosphere was loud, and filled with a bunch of old lushes in the middle of the afternoon I would hardly call this place a restaurant but describe it more as a local bar. Which is fine if that's what your into , but if your looking to go an enjoy a nice lunch with a nice atmosphere and good food there are many other great choices around in the same plaza or down the street at the quarter.

xnLHxqJXryTsJKkyH2W4mQ.text: Happened upon this "dive" bar after brunch on a Saturday. Patrons inside waved and said hello on our entrance. We felt like we belonged! The bartender was very friendly and offered us a food menu and poured our drinks promptly. The atmosphere was eclectic to say the least but charming at the same time! I will definitely return!

FcWAhsAdV13DafoGLNd-GQ.text: We started with the Buffalo Chips and my husband ordered the French Dip and I got the Pita sandwich. Holy crap the food is ridiculously delicious. pYXfMIowO2rJtYMmL1gp5w.text: I went with a group of 5 friends last night to this establishment. We made a reservation as we had read all of the great reviews on Yelp about the Rooster Tavern. We experienced terrible service as the waitress was not attentive considering it was not busy for a Saturday night. Long story short, we cancelled our food and went elsewhere. My friend had already left a comment on Yelp and on Facebook about our experience so I was not going to. However, after the response he received from Rooster, I feel compelled to leave a comment about our dissatisfaction with this establishment. The gentleman who replied was informal as he used young kid 'lingo' when responding. But he seemed apologetic and many of us have worked in the food industry before. We know there are good nights and bad nights. We were willing to give this place another go in the future until the gentleman felt the urge/need to leave a snide remark at the very end of his reply. Sir, you are in the service industry. There are going to be rough days when you will have a customer comment that you may not like/ agree with. However, you do not respond by insulting your guests, especially not online when future guests will be turned off by the bad attitude. The appropriate move would have been to approach our table when the server informed you a party was cancelling their order. But we were not approached so the issue remained unsolved and that is the reason why you have disappointed guests. We ended up driving five minutes up the road to Four Peaks. We had impeccable service and the manager heard what an awful experience we had at the Rooster so he brought us dessert on the house. Four Peaks will get our business in the future due to their outstanding service and attentive workers.

4BIUrvvwWxAFu9T13NE11Q.text: We were on staycation at the Princess and wanted to find a casual place that we could get food and some drinks. Since there was 8 of us, I called ahead and asked if they would be able to accommodate our large party. Jason the owner told me no problem come on down. When we got there he had 2 booths ready for us. This was perfect since half of our group were kids, they sat at one table and adults at another table. (Side note: for a "bar" type atmosphere it was mild enough for kids, however we are pretty kickback about stuff like that. Some might feel it isn't really kid friendly) I digress, the waitress was the only one there taking care of the entire restaurant but we never were neglected and everything we ordered came out quickly and correct. Holy cow the food was awesome! Wings had great flavor, burgers were juicy and huge, tacos were bomb! As we were leaving Jason came by and asked us how everything was and gave us his card and said to call him if we ever want to have a party or have any issues at the restaurant. Service was great, food was excellent, and the price was reasonable. It was a great start to our staycation!

VyYCLOAF4syBohvJmkDlLA.text: A night on the town or a nice evening alone The Rooster Tavern meets all of our needs.  To start the Shrimp Tacos and Meatball Sliders melt in your mouth. It's on the top of our list everyday of the week!

Lots of regulars here with a huge bar and plenty of TV's to watch the games.  They also have a vending machine that dispenses Rooster T-Shirts and all proceeds go to support veterans. Love the Rooster memorabilia. We will be back again.    #COCKSTRONG.

dZW-4zQCIYSlVv6ChYggtw.text: Made a quick first stop in here for March madness and it seems to be a nice place where most everyone who walks inside is a regular. They always have Hamm's drafts for 3 bucks, but one of those is about the limit on bad beer. Otherwise, I tried the pretzels and cheese for $6.99, which was an unusual presentation. The pretzels were cut in pieces, toasted and buttered and garlicked. It was a crunchy dip into the cheese bath and worth the price. Plenty of TV sets, daily specials and unusual decor make this place a good stop in the Scottsdale bar world, but mostly for regulars.

photos.caption: Photo of The Rooster Tavern - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Crunchy pretzels
Photo of The Rooster Tavern - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Logo

PwtY6hPcHKpHLWYHE9hOdg.text: We had to venture out of our normal comfort zone to go to Shane Co & stopped in here for a late lunch. This place has a dark/gothic, but still welcoming feel to it. I can't really put my finger on it, but would agree with other reviews that it's like an upscale dive bar!  Our server was Jessica & she was great! Super nice & helpful! We had a lot of food (hanger had set in). We ordered a cup of the chicken soup (chef's special) that was bomb, the meatball plate with a side of spaghetti that was delicious! The pasta was cooked well also. My husband had the buffalo chicken wings with ranch & an order of their buffalo chips-he said it was all delicious & the buffalo sauce had a kick, but not too spicy. Their wings are baked instead of fried, which was nice! My husband also ordered a single crispy fish taco. Yes, just one and he absolutely loved that too!  I'd definitely return here and would especially recommend for the crispy fish tacos!

photos.caption: Photo of The Rooster Tavern - Scottsdale, AZ, United States
Photo of The Rooster Tavern - Scottsdale, AZ, United States
Photo of The Rooster Tavern - Scottsdale, AZ, United States

jY7m11CwzTpmqRP8k0lUmQ.text: Service was good, friendly, prompt and such. The place is clean for sure. The beer selection is fairly large, if only a bit pedestrian...meaning not much in the craft beer selection.   I had a meatball sandwich. It too was good.   I would say it was good. Extraordinary? Maybe not, but a solid place to visit and I can see many drinks being had here.

photos.caption: Photo of The Rooster Tavern - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Meatball sandwich

C1dpCiKe2IdrtMczmIRVxQ.text: What a VERY eclectic place.  Fun atmosphere and lively crowds greeted us as we came in.  We were able to get a table near the bar easily.  The menu was not overwhelming and everything looked yummy!  We ordered the buffalo chips and the pretzel appetizers and both were very good.  A quick warning about the buffalo chips - they are SHARP!  The hubby loved the taste - I was only down for a few because I am a wimp!  I ordered the lobster mac and cheese an HOLY WOW was it fantastic.  Huge chunks of lobster and so much food I took home a doggie bag.  We will definitely come back.  Small warning - GPS directions are a little lame.  It's in the back strip mall on the corner - look for the GIANT RED ROOSTER TAVERN BUS!!!!!!!!!!!!!

PPnAFBre9Z-_Y7nN4KDdQQ.text: Found this local bar a couple months ago. Great atmosphere, great food. Really enjoy the patrons. All the bartenders work hard. Cody is very attentive to everyone. Guitar music Friday and Saturday when I have been there is very good, and enjoyable. The people seem to really enjoy the moment. They have two dart birds for fun. Over all, great time, and easy to meet people.  Lastly the door man host is supper nice when he is there! I'll definitely be back.

YQO4qFo_8gp50uBLWOEHeQ.text: Stopped in to sample the place heard it was worth checking out it was a great dive bar. Well better than dive bar in decor and the music was some great rock n roll. The wings are great excellent even although they are pricey for only 8 wings.  The meat ball slide was pretty good a bit heavy on the salt other wise fantastic. Well I highly recommend staying away from mixed drinks  not well made, he'll order a beer you cannot go wrong with a cold brew. Enjoy

photos.caption: Photo of The Rooster Tavern - Scottsdale, AZ, United States

JtLlQT2mU7wpg3671ZOJlA.text: I was raised in the South and know good fried chicken and mashed potatoes. I can honestly say, Rico's is THE BEST!!! I have had many meals here and none of them have disappointed me. The prime rib dip is another awesome item on their menu. Casual environment and the bartender Julia is always on point with serving drinks and great conversations. So glad this is in my neighborhood!

VuZPGB-IXo0tuPs9GBempw.text: Disappointment.  Usually I love this place.  The lobster mac and cheese was not good - four people at the table tried it, and we all agreed it was overly fishy.   Maybe shame on me for ordering lobster in the desert southwest, but I made sure to let the server know that it was not  to anyone's liking.  I would have expected him to offer to replace it with a different dish, or take it off the bill, as 85% of it was left on the plate when it was taken from the table.  No such courtesy was offered.  Maybe it was just this one server, on this one night,  but the experience left a bad taste in my mouth, both literally and figuratively.  Unfortunate, because the rest of the food we ordered was pretty decent.

UOE-GaVSLujYiw14UieY3A.text: Wow!  We are pro fish fry eaters!  Jason and his crew are amazing!  I believe this is the best fish fry in the entire area, but more importantly the best fun restaurant in the whole region! This place is great for any age any where in AZ!  Thank you Rooster for multiple great visits!

photos.caption: Photo of The Rooster Tavern - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Fish Fry Experts from Chi-Town....

rFfcBfU8rw7sAK6QhsCC6Q.text: Stiff drinks with a cool atmosphere. Although I was the only black person there I still felt comfortable and service was great. They showed me love for being a Veteran and my drinks were perfect. Whoever's the Sunday lunch bartenders had me lit like New Year's day lol. Food was very good, I had a variety of pretzel bun sliders which were all delicious. I am a fan of cocktails and their top shelf variety was ok. I'd like to see some more brands on their liquor shelf but other than that it's a cool place. The ambiance was cinematic and eclectic very cool setting with tons of ahh haa's on the wall.

HbeU8rxRHPEqptfSD9XVDQ.text: Love this bar...great management and staff, food is awesome and they have great music!  Mark Florentine kills it Friday nights!

653dPw-Nz5KJjoqMN4m2jw.text: Great ambience, love the music in the background. All good Rock from fantastic groups. Lots of TV's to catch up on sports events.  Great service by Rachel!!  For a "Dive" bar, this one takes the Gold Medal!

photos.caption: Photo of The Rooster Tavern - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Starting out right with drinks!

V1BmsSFJz3GDmf4uhlc3Ww.text: My husband and I found this place on Yelp while searching for a good French Dip nearby. We were greeted by the owner who was really welcoming, friendly and down-to-earth. The food was great. The ambiance was cool. Good Happy Hour. We will be back for sure.

xBBcYruS7IYz54bpWjmLhw.text: We've been here several times now.  Always consistent on food and drinks and a fun atmosphere.  We love the rooster!

photos.caption: Photo of The Rooster Tavern - Scottsdale, AZ, United States
Photo of The Rooster Tavern - Scottsdale, AZ, United States
Photo of The Rooster Tavern - Scottsdale, AZ, United States

rM1eYNP4Co_7BPBYaCNqVQ.text: Phenomenal wings, great drinks, you'll like this place as it's a great neighborhood bar/restaurant.  Gets pretty packed and the view wasn't too bad either..  ;)

OyWZueRkztowblTbKioB1A.text: Had been here 4 times previous and had solid 4 star experience.  Brought some friends having told them it was a great place.  In the past, owners seemed to be in the house and things ran well.  First, they were under staffed, so the nice waitress really struggled getting drink orders then our orders.  Took forever for order of wings to arrive.  When they did, half  were burned black and inedible.  When we pointed it out to the waitress she first seemed not to know what to do then said she'd get us some new ones.  What she brought was five flat wings to replace the number she thought were burnt.  When our sandwiches arrived very much later, my Ruben was not toasted and the corned beef was full of gristle and impossible to eat. The fries were like pieced of wood and terrible.  When I asked for a manager, they said we don't have one, but we could talk to the bar tender.  I explained all the issues and their solution was to pay for our 2 drinks.  Maybe they just had a bad night, but for me I'm done. I eat out 100's of times per year.  This was the worst experience I have had in recent memory.  Beware of the 4.5 star as I believer it will be trending south.

ec8xrM4TYXGwg_ZL96439g.text: This was by far one of the coolest bars I've been to. The decor is industrial biker-ish. Great food. Great drinks. Great staff.

photos.caption: Photo of The Rooster Tavern - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Checking out the Rooster Tavern. Pretty cool so far.

ignXZnQ6IbnwuPrFV2DEgA.text: We were visiting from California and wanted a cool chill place to celebrate my husbands 30th Birthday, The Rooster Tavern was perfect. It was low key but had a cool vibe inside. I loved the description "luxury dive bar." The food was amazing- tacos, chicken sandwich, fish sandwich, and especially the fries. The wait staff and owner were personal and even gave my husband a birthday shot.

TIg2Ql0hjiwmxcv2uS56YA.text: Found this on yelp for "places near me" while visiting Az. What a score. Nice patio area. Great menu options. French dip and chicken sandwich might have been the best I've tasted in a loooong time. Service was good, pleasant and efficient. Will definitely be back again when in the area

2pHhCy-cafWCWvgtF0CVHA.text: The Rooster Tavern is exactly just what our neighborhood needed. Easy access to drive or ride your bike to. Hell they even have golf carts parked in front. The inside is so well designed we felt right at home the minute we walked in. The decor is beautiful and very interesting. The staff is attentive and very accommodating. Carly the waitress and Charlie who does a little of everything, are so dang cute. Everyone there is so friendly. We love the MIND ERASER MENU, that is totally something we have never seen before, and we have been mind eraser drinkers for a long time. Be sure to try 1 when you are there! The Lavosh is off the hook good as well.. It comes 2 different ways and we will try the Tuna tomato next time we are there. Great place to hang out and meet people that's for sure. Thank you all for making us feel so welcome! Welcome to the neighborhood! Can't wait to go back for another round of Mind Erasers!

photos.caption: Photo of The Rooster Tavern - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Guns and Roses Pinball machine besides dart boards. Just a fun place to relax and hang out at! Come have a few adult beverages with us!
Photo of The Rooster Tavern - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Cocktail hour is a good hour for us! And the drinks are perfectly poured!
Photo of The Rooster Tavern - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. The decor is done so well and very eclectic!

YkXW2Lsc9WCmDGSL7haddw.text: Ok seriously!!!!!!!!! Best new place in Scottsdale!!! Staff, decor, f'n music all 10's!!! We have been begging for a place like this for years!! Well it's here! If your looking for a place that covers all the bases, The Rooster Tavern is the place! Owner of the place greeted us, sat us and made us feel like family!!! This is a go to for neighborhood people and for anybody looking for what I call a modern dive bar!!! I'm sold!!

Qfj9SjWVRPFwJgTXBibknw.text: My wife and I decided to try out The Rooster Tavern last night for dinner. I saw they had a French Dip sandwich on the menu. I always love a good French Dip sandwich so I ordered it. I was blown away by how fresh the bread was and the prime rib in it with the melted cheese was perfect! It was the best French Dip sandwich I have ever had and will be going back again soon!

bxcvR3CgBz60URRSlfEuOA.text: Great food and service. Had the French onion dip, friend had the pear and kale salad... both great! Mac and cheese a little small portion but good.

u7LHqPOsLm9JX5a5ySiN5w.text: The BEST French Dip sandwich in the Valley hands down. I'll be back to try the wings.

MKsAmChAV02W2tS0f2CJog.text: By far the best Italian Sub I've had! Gotta try the meatballs and spaghetti squash too.. absolutely phenomenal! The owner Jason is always there and always stops by to check and make sure everything is good. Great neiborhood bar!

R0jhInHCmcvwWnfuPfKy8Q.text: Wow! This place is incredible! Amazing food! Amazing service! Such a great little Gem for Scottsdale! If you have not been you need to go!

fiK6aiLSOY1v01ZBHiqx2A.text: Neighborhood bar in Scottsdale. It has the small town bar feel. You're only a stranger once. Food is good. Pretzel rolls meatball sliders are great. Wings are baked and sauced. Service was friendly and efficient but food came out randomly. Nice spot

BAMbDPUawCZzxKBJg1gNyA.text: Perfect place for an afternoon bite to eat! Very cool ambiance. Somewhere I could hang out at during the day for lunch and come back for the weekend!

1z2OIe1vmgi9BQ_EEoN-IQ.text: Owner Jason waited on us immediately introduced us to the menu. Very comfortable place and personable staff. Met the chef and waitress. Enjoyed our meal and staff. Highly recommend.

GI6fylaw5sp0WWvUBhYC5A.text: This place is great! Great atmosphere, delicious food, generous drink pours. The staff is awesome! 5+ stars!

2gTMrSr8tlCOcgiZJWPd9Q.text: My husband and I were looking for a low key place to enjoy good apps and a cold drink on a Sunday afternoon.  FOUND IT. Great atmosphere.  Really good food, (try the chicken wings and meatball sliders). Great service,  good music, and good vibes.  We are definitely coming back!

FKI9B53ZXVE-7KXaGjJrCQ.text: Visiting from out of town. Thought we'd check this place out based on menu/reviews. It's described as a "dive bar," but I don't agree. It's got a lot of character, not at all "divey" (whatever that means...to me, dirty, greasy, questionable). Husband had the chicken wings, I had the au jus sandwich. We should have switched, as I preferred his wings, and he loved my sandwich! Well, to each their own. I ordered a glass of red wine, which was served ice cold. I just asked that it be given a twenty second nuke, and it was much better! All in all, if we found ourselves in Scottsdale again, we'd have no compunction about visiting the Rooster again.

0aENWCMWLKvOnS0RmUorUQ.text: Had the Cuban sandwich today. Phenomenal!  Service here is always great, owner is always out, friendly, and adds to the experience.    Love this place. Not sure I have ever had even a 4 star experience here... Always 5 Stars!

_N-VAcungZNNZ5d48KtHyQ.text: This is a must go to bar and grill. The food is extremely good the service and staff are the best. It's like a casual capitol grill. This is my first choice for a night out. Keep it up.

dCf8u06BlZw3F5Bg2EQbAw.text: Not good. Really horrible service. You can sit at a table three feet from the bar and nobody will approach your table for twenty minutes.  Bar tenders slow to acknowledge customers when they walk up. Bar tenders more interested in talking to each other than servicing customers. Also, I've been in this industry for 18 years, so I feel like I'm a good judge of bar service.

hkbSBuhKlxFjq-qdnr3qiA.text: Love this place, great food and drinks, atmosphere, vibe, ambiance, friendly good service. Love the Awesome chandeliers and woman friendly restroom. Whether you're a local or from out of town, you can't go wrong with this place.

uJCm3mvBBkEtt7grLEROfQ.text: This was truly a surprise. It's a fun place, not fancy, but comfortable.  The food and service were supurb!  The steak special was cooked to perfection and the potato pancakes had a nice crisp texture.  All in all a great experience.

p4-EZL1DmzJp0A5g2dH6aA.text: Amazing! Do yourself a favor and try this place! The wings are phenomenal , servers are so friendly and nice . Love it! Everything we have had here is delicious ! Will be coming back again and again!

f4DMHyRt5BQJ7lOXXO5zRQ.text: Random selection of neighborhood bars that we haven't been to today. This was the right choice! We love the atmosphere and the people. Food was excellent and the drinks were spot on. We'll be back again and again!

pBfyJS4WhhecsI99Zgjvnw.text: I was here last Friday for happy hour it was packed and fun. Bartenders were great - Monday night bartender a little more serious .  Friday I got happy hour ahi on wontons tonight getting the meatballs with fries!  They have entertainment on the weekends- and a good crowd . Looking forward to bring my fr

Photo of The Rooster Tavern - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Mmmmm
Photo of The Rooster Tavern - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Tavern feel

YuTVZcAZR0kluPOxLBbJFg.text: I was on my way to a restaurant across the way from The Rooster Tavern when a small red school bus with a Rooster attracted us.  We went inside the tavern and found a loud (in a good way), active, happy crowd.  I asked to see the menu and Rico, the person serving as host, gave us information on the menu and the special of the day:  All you can eat codfish.  He was super, friendly and so likable that we decided to stay.   We ordered beer, All u can eat cod dinner and a burger with a salad.  They give you the choice of salad instead of french fries. The cod was delicious, crispy and not greasy. The burger was a half pound burger with the usual toppings.  The meat was fresh but the burger needed a good char on the outside to impart better flavor.   The vibe was great.  Music started at about 8 PM which was nice, but it was very hard to have a conversation (actually even before the music) since the place was packed. Jessica was our most charming server--helpful, attentive and friendly.   Congrats to Rico (who I understand is the chef) for enticing us to try The Rooster Tavern.  See u soon.

photos.caption: Photo of The Rooster Tavern - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. 8 ounce burger perfectly cooked.
Photo of The Rooster Tavern - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. All u can eat fish!!  Yup!!!! Delish. Little outside crust which is a good thing
Photo of The Rooster Tavern - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Look at the thickness of that burger!  Great bun too.

4aXKbzXQbIs-AnJg9XKx9w.text: My friends and I went to this place tonight and it was great!  The food was good but the staff was outstanding they were funny and welcoming we really appreciated it!! I've been here on weekend nights and it's pretty loud with the music but Tuesday night happy hour was much more my speed. Thanks to Andy and The tall guy that found the sun glasses!

qZkKtNQe6JGrpiqkDTQ_aw.text: The chicken dinner is made in house. It was fantastic. Really a great meal at a great price.  Green chili cheese crisp was great.  The lobster macaroni and cheese was good. Lobster seemed not so fresh tonight but the restaurant still gets 5 stars. Service was excellent. Manager or owner was welcoming.

Photo of The Rooster Tavern - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Chicken dinner Wednesday
Photo of The Rooster Tavern - Scottsdale, AZ, United States

8ToaDCMvV6zWwvgAbzfWNA.text: We had a friendly waitress and tried the flavorful potent Ang's blueberry moonshine. The meatball slider was very good, I'd eat that again. The burger slider was good and nice presentation.   The tacos were small and okay

photos.caption: Photo of The Rooster Tavern - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Handsome greeting Rooster at patio outside door.
Photo of The Rooster Tavern - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Left corner see the roosters head, so creative.

kgv0LeR_xj2iAHtCz8qelQ.text: If I could give zero stars I would. Horrible service, I will never be back, way too loud, way too crowded and the extremely rude servers won't even give you the time of day let alone allow you to walk between their overly crowded seating. First time here and I wish I could take it back. I can't say enough bad things about this place. If you want to enjoy a time out with friends, pick another place because this one isn't worth your time or money.

82dZyYQHen9fsq-1fx_mFA.text: What a pleasant surprise. We arrived in town a little early for our hotel. They had informed us they would call when our room was ready. We decided to go get a small bite to eat or have some drinks.  We found this little place.  Some girl had her dog in there for two hours. I felt sorry for the dog.  The meatballs were extraordinary.  We only had a few apps. I enjoyed a margarita.  We enjoyed sitting there listening to the music.

0VywjbNDzhAo9vA9Zf9wIw.text: The coolest dive bar!  Came here on a Saturday night to watch the ASU game with some friends...the atmosphere is so unique and fun! We walked in, most of us wearing some type of ASU gear, the owner asked if they were playing- we said yes and he told us where to sit so we could get a good spot to watch the game from the TV's that had the channel available AND then he came by and switched another one to the channel so we could see the screen from a few angles at this big round table. Nicest guy and that made for an immediate great 1st impression and experience!  We ordered the pretzel and cheese appetizer and a round of beers. Lots of draft options and fully stacked bar.   I ordered the chicken pesto sandwich (chicken, pesto mayo, lettuce, tomato, onion on a bun) with fries. One of my friends ordered the same thing and then the other members of our group ordered meatball sliders, burgers, and the French dip.   Everyone was really happy with the food! It came out hot the fries were awesome! The chicken sandwich has a great piece of chicken on it. We both mixed it with a little ranch because the pesto flavor didn't really seem present in the pesto mayo; overall I'd definitely get it again though.   Another great part- they had a guy performing acoustic guitar and singing and he was phenomenal! He played classic rock, country, and many other great tunes!  For a first experience here, this place was top notch! It got really busy as we were getting ready to leave and we could see why- great service and food. There are so many options on the menu too-we'll definitely be back to try out some other things!

photos.caption: Photo of The Rooster Tavern - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Pretzel bites and cheese
Photo of The Rooster Tavern - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Grilled Chicken Pesto Sandwich &amp; Fries

WYeFGoyXXi3eDwhGDvatTQ.text: Me and my girlfriend stumbled upon this place going somewhere else and I'm happy we did. Food was amazing. I had the fried chicken sandwich (sorry no pics) lol and it was delicious. My gf had the fried fish sandwich which was also tasty but my sandwich was better (because men make better decisions when it comes to food) lol we both had spicy margaritas and we're HUGE tequila and spice fans and the wale tequila actually was pretty good. Kudos to them for hooking us up. Service was what you would expect from a bar/tavern type of joint so no complaints. The ONLY complaint I have is that they have a guitarist who is pretty terrible and who is EXTREMELY loud to the point you have to yell to have a conversation. But other than that it's a great place to chill, hang and have drinks.

SEQDTeAyVRMcwNJfx9c7Gg.text: Overall this was a great meal. Started with the Happy Hour Calamari which had some onion and jalapeno added to it. The sauce that came on the plate was limited and shuttle in flavor but added some additional taste to it.   I got to try a bite of the Boursin Burger. Solid burger based on the bite I had. The others at the table who ordered it really enjoyed it. The temps were a little off (med rare was more a med/med well).   I had the Hatch Green Chili Hash with a couple of eggs added. As a huge fan of Hash I ordered with great hope and I was not disappointed. This is a great Hash!  The flavor of the Green Chili's added a ton to this dish. The Hash was perfectly cold with the potatoes not too soggy or hard. The flavor was fantastic. The great addition of the tortillas to sop up the juice at the bottom of the plate made sure you missed nothing.

photos.caption: Photo of The Rooster Tavern - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Hatch Green Chili Hash
Photo of The Rooster Tavern - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Calamari

1gggc6yl3bQDrw-ayddkUQ.text: Great spot.  Friendly staff.  Price is right.  Highly recommended.   One of a kind in a sea of sameness in Scottsdale.  Locals hangout.  Something for everyone on the menu.

1kyFvRPSj2bmRbYgwgDIAQ.text: Found this spot last week and loved it. It is tucked back in a shopping mall but don't let that fool you. It has tons of character. It was a Thursday and the had live music starting around 8-ish- as the bartender said. Live music was really good. We had some beers. Their menu does not match what they actually have but they had enough of a variety. Fun decor. Really nice bartenders. You can tell they have regulars that go their often.  If you are in the neighborhood- check this place out!

photos.caption: Photo of The Rooster Tavern - Scottsdale, AZ, United States

L4WLkLHz0C7aFGQRNkwYqw.text: Really good food, amazing local vibe you'll run into at least 10 locals on any given day which is hard to find in Scottsdale nowadays. However, the staff is not friendly the women are a lot like waitresses at Dicks Last Resort.

E2uvTz877dKxbl7dC4D9Lg.text: Surprisingly good food for a pub! The meatball sliders were flavorful and tasty. The burger slider was pretty good too. It comes with a dip so it's more of a French dip than a hamburger, but still good.   The pretzels and cheese dip was really good! The pretzels are sliced, which makes them great to dip in the cheese dip.   The server was really friendly but there was only one person there. They weren't swamped but it seemed like they couldn't used more help.

photos.caption: Photo of The Rooster Tavern - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Hamburger sliders with au jus dip. Tastes more like a French dip but still yummy!
Photo of The Rooster Tavern - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Meatball sliders - yum!
Photo of The Rooster Tavern - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Pretzels with cheese dip. Yum!

B4ZF2RzuldQtjGjZioVWxA.text: My wife found your sticker on my car window. I told her I was going out for pizza. She threw me out. Thanks guys. Great marketing! Can I sleep in your Rooster bus for a while? But seriously, not cool putting an adhesive sticker on someone's car especially in the Arizona heat. Very cheesy. If I caught them putting it on my car then they would be wearing it on their forehead.

Vn96Sx4TdeAfUY1x5bjODA.text: Me and my boyfriend decided to give this establishment a try based off the reviews. When we arrived it was so cool inside. It was a place that I bet is fun on a weekend night. Very cool concept and interior design. The food was fast and good. My boyfriend had the fish sandwich and he enjoyed it. I had the veggie beef soup. It has great flavor but pretty salty. (Thank goodness for water pills) we would definitely come back and see other items on the menu.   Staff was super friendly and it was very clean as were the bathroom. Awesome job rooster tavern

JodGTfX8CpmDkXPw3RcOLQ.text: A buddy and I stopped in last night for happy hour. The decor inside was really cool and it was packed. The reason for the 2 stars was strictly the service. There were probably 2 servers for the entire bar. We scored a table and waited about 20 minutes until we went to the bar to get a drink. When we finished our drink, still no one to check on us. Would have loved to try the food but we decided to move on to another bar. Might give it one more try based on the other reviews.

9ERqrIt3EPu1Rob833HPpA.text: Probably one of the coolest dive bars I've ever been into. It's not flashy at all on the outside it's all saved for the inside. Definitely a hidden gem. Staff was amazing. Food was great!

4uWoOyavBSPBssB8opllbA.text: Very cool atmosphere in this dive bar!! We were there for lunch and it was a little slow but we got great service. Good was pretty good and beer was cold!!! We will go back

OfZYJbUWKnsdo-vncfIi2A.text: We were so pleasantly surprised with The Rooster! So many restaurants to choose from but I will choose this one again!  The food, although not unusual, cooked perfectly with top notch ingredients. The menu was simple but included choices for all. The wine list was short, but inclusive of interesting choices. Wine glasses were perfect size. Owner was kind enough to greet folks and chat us up, being present and interested.  Seats are comfortable, and overall vibe was inviting. Good job Rooster, we will return!

gqqC8GOUEkvQoTRo-UjESg.text: Was in town Monday for some family issues.  Decided to go out and have dinner at RA.  Upon leaving I noticed this place and decided to check it out.  Wow was I glad I did.  The theme-ing was super cool and fun and the drinks were strong and reasonably priced.  The man working there told me he was the owner and explained that they had just opened.  It looks like they spent a fortune on making the place so I do hope it sticks around because I would love to come back and have some more drinks and try the food that I didn't get a chance to!  Really nice place, I spent a long time just looking at all the stuff they had hanging on the walls and all the details.  Will be back soon I hope!

NfP7K8kUZqbULbQBt2LrhQ.text: Great bar, good menu selections and very affordable. Nice addition to the neighborhood!

S6bktEV3Y8XjnB1mhBqM-g.text: Have been looking for a bar like this in the area for a while. I will for sure be a repeat customer. Super excited to have a bar like this in the area.

2N4H4pmwiVfu4jnpaRrvsQ.text: One of my favorite spots in Scottsdale. Great food and awesome customer service. This is my go to spot!

VPs-kLMqSvXGfaWzLqITEQ.text: We had great service and the food was really good! Love this new neighborhood place! Highly recommend it. Brittany rocked as our server.  Give local business your support. Good recommendation Roger W!

PiTtbD4NnaENy8xCtBeEGA.text: We knew this place opened recently and decided to walk there this afternoon for a snack.  We had a couple of beers and ate some hummus and wings. The wings were baked and grilled. The food was tasty and a bit healthier than a typical tavern/pub.  I'm a porter/stout fan and the lack of those on tap was a bit of a miss for me but otherwise we like the place and will definitely be back.    The owner and bartender both introduced themselves to us.  They were very friendly which I appreciate and the bartender mentioned they would be adding more beers and rotating them as well so hopefully that will include a porter or stout.

tjnNhglX-Xv7U0r2jQmc_w.text: We went here last night... good service...fun theme...I got the street tacos and everything about was outstanding.  the salsa was incredible.

wWNJ8BvUq2beQegs5_Lz4Q.text: My new favorite bar. The decor is welcoming. The staff is fantastic. And who doesn't love a bar that serves spaghetti with Bolognese sauce. Looking forward to trying more of the menu, but the spaghetti rocked.

cHALOIgQHsi41JPIxgUPrA.text: Peg and I visited this place a few days ago and absolutely loved the experience!  Joe was our server and even with his other role as a bartender took great care of us and my water addiction. The wings (got half bbq, half honey hot) are baked and grilled, and they were delicious. The bruschetta was topped with ripe marinated tomatoes and boursin cheese on top of crispy (not burned or soggy!) baguette. Peg had a very tasty tuna (albacore) melt and my French dip was NOT overly salty which can easily happen with au jus. Salads were fresh and the Caesar dressing was terrific. This place is a find, and while you need to look for it a bit in a shopping center...it is worth the discovery!

OdABRRWg2tw2CGjFoCMKgw.text: Awesome place! Cody and Joe are great bar tenders and Chef Rico's food is ALWAYS great. A True diamond in the rough. Shhhh. Don't tell anyone. Oh, and a future Nebraska Cornhusker bar!!

SHQv5T13F0w7DpdIe0tfWw.text: Has a lot of promise!  New and exciting in the heart of north town. Come try a new spot that could become a regular joint. Great people and a lot of fun.

wpuohjlDaI2tbT_w9PpyJg.text: Loved it! Great vibe and super friendly people. Casual eclectic decor, skeeball and darts! I highly recommend and I haven't yet mentioned the food!? Something on the menu for everyone, fabulous presentation and DELICIOUS! Beats those big chains hands down. Go go go!!

TNyZbA-zik23ues86TLVqQ.text: The food was good for the price point and the service was good as well.  The patio area is dog friendly and the atmosphere is relaxed.

3qkB4HqRtva3kHMFIGCEXg.text: Just a great bar great service not the usual like Zips or Gallagher's you can eat their bar food and get a drink, this place has great bartenders, good bar food and servers.

ZIhGiWmIFFxLUS-LpTY7Vw.text: During our first week in our new hometown, we had been shopping for emergency items until our storage unit arrived.  Hunger had taken over and we Yelp-ed a restaurant in the area.  This place came up. We had the kiddoes with us (11 & 15) on a Sunday afternoon and hoped the place lived up to the reviews.  Tables were empty but the bar seemed full.  We waited for what seemed like 15 minutes with no server to be found.  We were about ready to leave when someone came over and asked if we wanted to see a menu.  What?!?  Service was just OK- food was great.  We knew that we weren't "regulars" but we didn't expect to feel like outsiders.  Not sure if we will return for the food because the service was blah.

KBQQ4DxNN6GSU3lotSV-aQ.text: So glad to have this spot in the neighborhood! Food is delicious (you must try the meatballs) and great beer and wine selection. Fun atmosphere too!! We stopped in for Happy Hour and will definitely be coming back again and again :)

hMLwwI8it2RWVn0aqOpUsg.text: Great food, especially the ceviche....ahh man.  Good people, happy to see this place so close to home. Good spot for sure. Golden Tee, good taps, good people.

Sa6EzrMMjD846cFtaAzrEA.text: Stopped by here with friends for some drinks and we made a good choice! Great bar, great decor, good vibes, great drinks! Even have skeeball in the back! Highly recommend to anyone looking for a cool neighborhood bar to meet up with friends or meet new people!

vqSPrvjtW2IjoAx-OG2WtA.text: Welcome to the neighborhood!!!! Very friendly atmosphere!  Owner Jason in, even on  a Sunday! Superb customer service! Chef Rico knocks it out of the park!!!! Best wings in town! Spaghetti squash and zucchini spirals...... we will see you soon! Diane and John Your Scottsdale Neighbors

D2Zmoe72FHccd8R6z-AQ5w.text: What a great surprise this was. Great food and great atmosphere. The meatball sliders are so very tasty and the French Dip - wow!  This little place is a hidden Hideway!! Service is great...

Wi7chLtOk29m7NaEbkOiMA.text: Cool looking place but it was noisy at happy hour (we had to yell) and only 1/3 items we ordered were really good. Pretzel - do not order it. The cheese sauce must be cheese whiz. Zero creativity and straight from a can most likely. Burger slider - awesome. Fish taco - mediocre. Probably will try it again for happy hour sometime. BTW there are no food specials. Only drinks.

msp8tDk7O9vfUzNnI6DotA.text: I came here just on a whim .... driving by I saw a sign for 3 dollar sliders. Service was a bit slow but hey ... it's Saturday afternoon .... what the heck do I care ?   The owner ... which I forget his name now was actually who served us . I asked for a recommendation and he suggested the sliders. I got two meatball sliders, one burger slider, and my fiance got the tacos.   Meatball sliders are what puts this place at 5 stars . I make a damn good meatball myself .... and these were on point if not better than my own .   Tacos were solid too and the atmosphere of the place is just wacky and fun .   I'd suggest coming here if you get the chance .... it's affordable and good

jS8mjVN4bQFk3A88Zt_ysg.text: Immediately, the place took me to some of my favorite places in old town Vegas.  Dark, cool and friendly.  Great drink specials.  Great food specials.    I like to read a places lowest yelp reviews first to get a feel for what people whine about.   After seeing the "books" a few people left on yelp about this place, I assessed this has to be the place for me.   I was spot on.  My first bite into the meatball slider we ordered took me straight to "Pizza Rock" in downtown Vegas (favorite place there to late eat and get a great beer).  So tasty and tender!!!  The wings are baked and char finished on the grill, just like I do them at home!  Buffalo sauce was popping with flavor.    We split the French dip and fries for the entree.  Fries were so crisp on the outside and mashed potato-like on the inside like fries should always be done!  The horse radish sauce and the au jus are a perfect accessory to this sandwich and did not disappoint.  I know it was a fluke, but we got a large tough piece of meat in the sandwich.  Thinner slices would easily remedy that from happening.    Over all I am extremely happy to have a great hangout for football season so close to my house!  Great work on this gem of a tavern!!

BHJg5YxkzRzuFOBfbF7shg.text: Of course I rely heavily on what others have to say about an establishment before making the decision to go.  The main motivation for coming here was proximity to home and the positive feedback it was receiving.  I understand it is a neighborhood bar with all the basic bar food, but it was so basic it was lackluster.  On a quiet Monday eve there were maybe half a dozen patrons, yet service was incredibly slow. Server seemed distracted and uninterested, I believe he may have been the bartender. Other people delivered our food and/or checked in on our table. At the end of my sojourn there we waited in vain for our check - which the server had forgotten about.  Buffalo wings that were ordered were incredibly dry and lacked the anticipated buffalo sauce. Even the sides of ranch and bleu cheese dressing were missing the key ingredient of flavor.  The buffalo meatballs, drenched in a buffalo and bleu cheese sauce, were disappontingly dry and flavorless.   No selection of drafts to be had here, and most of the beer offerings on the wall were domestics like bud and coors.  For a local tavern, I guess I expected there to be a more decent beer selection.   And that if the food offerings were known and customary bar food dishes, like wings, that there would be more of an emphasis on making those the best damn wings you have ever had.  Finally, no one cared whether we were there or would ever come back.  Honestly, I will often give a business my patronage just because the service rocks. This one, unfortunately, needs some work in all areas.

ZmMTHH_TkSZPY4wlLM5jEQ.text: I'm really warming up to this place... I love the decor of this bar. Very cool. I'm going to steal one of those black chandeliers when you guys aren't looking. All kidding aside, I went there last night and sat at the bar. The bartender was exceptionally attentive and fun. Then, I tried the meatballs and wow, they were yummy. Oh, I also tried my friend's mac and cheese with bacon which was just as good. I'm definitely coming back to see what else is on the menu. Kudos for the great service and food!

eleEFISMid-S3w7IR7f9_A.text: Stopped in for a quick drink on a Saturday night.  Had a couple of PBR's and sat at the bar. The food really looked great as it passed by us, but we did not order any. The acoustic guy in the corner was a nice addition to the bar.     Next time I'm in the area, I'll be sure to stop.

_XbvZRBBUejNysJVHLqNKA.text: Just discovered this amazing local spot ! The staff were incredibly attentive  as we sidled up to the bar . Ordered a couple pints of Uncle Bears beers and some of their signature baked then grilled wings , honey hot style .. SO GOOD ! The ambiance was so welcoming and all of the patrons , incredibly friendly ! My husband and myself were  blown away ! The Uncle Bears representatives gifted us glasses and stickers for trying the fantastic brews , the bartender kept samples coming to make sure we were satisfied with our choices !!  We shared the French Dip and we both view ourselves as experts & we loved the grilled onions and horseradish sauce & the au jus was perfect ! So happy to have discovered our new local hang out ! Do yourself a favor & visit this local gem ! You won't be disappointed !

7aYhtIfZ9Q5MlifILKotUw.text: Recovering Colon Surgery patient at MAYO craving these for 5 days. Finally get released for full food and send VERY EXPLICIT directions about adding EXTRA EXTRA SAUCE because it wont swallow easily.  ALSO request TWO ounces of Mayo, was given ONE once cup that was HALF FULL. Nothing says "we read your ticket and realized you paid DOUBLE to use us through GRUBHUB, but Hey, we really don't care THAT much about you...."  Totally. Wasted. Meal. TOO DRY TO EAT. I DONT SEE ANY SAUCE AT ALL on that pasta, much less EXTRA EXTRA SAUCE, now add that to the 1/4 order of mayonnaise requested and the pitiful half cup of au jus, and this all led to the entire meal being thrown in he trash after 3 bites of pasta and one slider.. too salty, too dry, too stupid to follow explicit instructions.  You RUINED this meal and promised a product you simply failed to deliver, you failed and I'm disappointed, an apology and a refund would be appropriate, Richard

JSJ-pXP07BrVLucSCsqOfQ.text: Lucky to find this place,  it is my kind of place.  Food is great and reasonably priced.  Staff is dialed in and very attentive.  We went two nights in a row and will probably hit it again on this road trip.  I love it.

-ehWKRSN2YVbbyA7NpVzgw.text: My husband and I are visiting Arizona so I checked a place to get a burger and The Rooster had high marks on Yelp so we went there.  Had a great burger and fries!  Not disappointed at all! Also our server, Rachel, was terrific, gave us some great info about the area which was much appreciated.  Most definitely will go back when visiting again.

nX5smPuWLUhgK6c2lZAjnw.text: Our first time here and we had high expectations because of the great reviews. Unfortunately this was not our experience. My wife ordered the chicken sandwich and salad. She is allergic to tomatoes and asked for no tomatoes. The salad ended up with tomatoes and the chicken sandwich was so dry that she couldn't eat it.   I had the meatball sliders which were pretty good but they were really soggy.   Our waitress only came by once after we were served our food which by then the chicken sandwich was cold.  I think this place has a lot of potential. It's super cute and decorated really cool. Because they recently opened maybe there are some kinks to work out.   I was really surprised that we were not offered to have our check adjusted since my wife could not eat the chicken sandwich.  We won't be back.

ab6in21Y3mFC7csMMX_OtA.text: Just added cubano sandwhich, best lunch & drinks in north scottsdale.  Don't forget the meatball sliders. Bam!   DDD should make an appearance..

photos.caption: Photo of The Rooster Tavern - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. They catered 300 meatball sliders for our office party, and not one slider was left over. This place has the best sliders in town. Period.

XnWZV0qdHGRPWySaxPkSVg.text: So far, not great. 30 minutes and we don't have our food. Restaurant serves Lays potato chips. Salad should come out before the entree. High top tables along the window are really crammed. Decor is cool. If this was bar rescue they would be failing the stress test.  The wedge was okay but it was way too small. Iceberg is cheap lettuce. Why skimp?  Menu said the French dip came with horseradish but it wasn't served with it. Waitress looked at me like I was crazy when I asked for it. I ate half the sandwich before she even came back with the horseradish. I weigh 160lbs. The sandwich was three bites with very little meat.  I don't normally write reviews like this but I felt like I had to. I would come back here to watch a game and sit at the bar. The only issue is there are only three TV's.  I gave it two stars to be nice.
